39945206.review:
Fancy pants is back, yet again! He's got even more fancy pants to show.

The game is really charming, it just feels like old newgrounds days all over again with some fresh new styles. It's still of course, an awesome painted world. As for the gameplay, it feels really nice and responsive, but it would be nice for some button configuration settings for some players. Fancy pants does keep his melee weapon from the old fancy pants adventure. Of course, with some new attacks, some of which are pretty neat, others may be a bit "meh" though. (I'm looking at you spinning attack >:C I WANT MY OLD SPINNING ATTACK BACK.)

There's a bunch of collectables too, in nearly every room there's a hidden door with a challenge room in it. Beat that and you got yourself some sick new pants, or even a completely new hat! 

The story is nothing over-the-top, with very little dialouge makes it very interesting for you to figure out what happens. Sometimes scenes just randomly HAPPEN while just going through the next screen. ...That's kind of it though for the story, the final boss is pretty trippy though. 

The game is uh... very short though, you could probably beat it in a few hours or so. You could always go back to levels and get the challenges, but if you are like me and just get every challenge in order.. there's not much else.

Luckily, the game knew about this. They added an entire new update with the entire remix world 1! Now you can collect MORE things! There's also races and even a whole arena gamemode, I do wonder how multiplayer can work. I can imagine it being fun.

My only real biggest concern of this game is the price, 10 dollars may be cheap for some people.. but a somewhat short game like this with not much content at the moment.. It's best if you wait for a sale perhaps or something else. Though, I bet they will add more updates though. Currently, it does feel pretty short. 

Overall, it's a charming and fancy game that brings back old and new memories and the gameplay is downright fun, but the price still concerns me of it's current content. 

I'd give it a 7.5/10 for now.. If they update this game even more I might edit this review! :D

39862383.review:
I like this game, but it's not without its issues. I've played the Flash FPA trilogy, and saw a promotion on the site, which led us to get this game. I really liked it at first, because it has more sound effects, such as for walking and landing, that weren't in the Flash version. And generally, it's just a fresher game with new worlds, enemies, and ideas. But then I wanted to start the game from the beginning, and there doesn't seem to be an option to do so. Even more baffling is that in the first 2 FPA flash games, you can reset your data. That is baffling, especially considering the fact those are Flash games, not Steam applications. I would expect more, not less. A multi-profile interface, for example. Also, an update was released around Christmas in 2017. And when I installed it, I noticed the game was slowed down to like half of its normal speed. That is annoying and baffling. Why did that happen? Now, I know this is just my experience. So if you have the same problem reading this, that would make this more of a problem. I'm using a Mac mini made in Late 2014 running the latest MacOS, High Sierra. I've also made 2 videos on this game and the things I did to it by getting into its contents, and am planning to make a 3rd one this week, so check them out here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7-kec4XzZkc&list=PLFbCE8Kkz-hm3ws_ammCIzWeWyVef6stY&index=8

Also, I was just about to post and was asked if I recommend this game. The answer is... yes & no, I guess. Depends on how much you like games like this, whether you're planning to get this for multiple users, and on how disappointing the lack of a profile interface is to you. Just want to point that out.

游戏流程很短，整个游戏仅仅100多M，而且多数地方用了一种放大的视角 不能直观的看到整个画面的物品
一共就7还是8个关卡，后期跑酷紧张刺激很有意思，前期就和普通的冒险游戏没什么区别，就是瞎跑瞎打打怪
路上收集的类似海螺的东西，也只能拿来升级，没有关卡收集作用【所以没有让人重复游玩的冲动】
每个图都有一个门，每个门里面都有一件新的头饰或者裤子
但是整体来讲，并不是很划算花20多去买这款游戏
--------------------------------------------------------------------
首先，衣服和裤子做工很粗糙，没有什么收集欲望，不影响游戏体验【且不如IOS手机端的Fancy Pants的内容丰富】

可惜怪的血量不是很多，Boss打起来又没有什么挑战性
总体而言，我个人觉得 这只是一款信仰作品而已，回馈一直以来都支持这款游戏的老粉丝
手机端的Fancy Pants发行的很早，这款17年9月份的作品，不仅没有延续手机端的丰富收集要素，也没有手机端的流程丰富
整体一个缩水作品，个人表示不是很满意
但是攻击手感，和场景动作的流畅度，我还是给一个好评，不知道会不会还有下一作，希望吸取这次经历越做越好

XBOX Oneコントローラーを使用。序盤をプレイした感想。

[u]戦闘よりも移動時の爽快性が売りの棒人間を操作してプレイする横スク2Ｄアクションパルクール系。[/u]

[h1][b]【良い点】[/b][/h1]

◆主人公が軽快に動くので、ステージ内を縦横無尽に駆け巡ることができてとても爽快だ。主人公は初期から壁蹴り（三角飛び）やスライディング等の移動が一通りできるのでストレスなくプレイできる。

◆収集要素として主人公の外見を変更する帽子やパンツの色を変更するインクを集めることが出来る。これによって主人公の能力が強化されることは無いので、無視してステージを進めても大丈夫なように作られている。

◆道中に高難易度の仕掛けがされている隠し部屋が存在し、クリアすることで上記した帽子等が入手できるようになっている。通常ステージ自体が比較的簡単なのに対して、こちらは難しいものが多く、攻略するのが楽しい。

[h1][b]【悪い点】[/b][/h1]

◆雑魚敵との戦闘自体にあまりメリットがなく、むしろゲームのテンポを落としてしまうので基本はスルー出来る場所はスルーしてしまいがちに。

◆ステージを進むのは爽快だが、所謂「クリア時の達成感」が薄い。

[h1][b]【総評】[/b][/h1]

雑魚敵の配置がいまいちなことを除けば良作。パルクール系のスピーディーな横スクアクションがプレイしたいのであればオススメだ。

プレイ動画をアップしているので、気になった方は[u][url=https://youtu.be/JeGSe84rNxY]こちら[/url][/u]を参考までにどうぞ。

38920194.review:
If you're a long-time veteran fan of the Fancy Pants series, I give to you one single piece of advice:

Go play World 3.

Super Fancy Pants Adventure, while still a fun time, is very much lacking when compared to the game's predecessor. The game is extremely short, and can be finished in under two hours, so, yes, you can refund this game as soon as you finish it unless you're incredibly slow. The only reason I didn't is because the developer, Brad Borne, is a nice dude, and I respect his work greatly.

Mobility features that greatly benefitted World 3, such as wallstepping and walljump direction jumping, are gone for seemingly no reason. I theorize that this is some sort of misguided effort to simplify the move pool, but you could've just had a short tutorial to explain it.

Familiar and fun enemies such as arachnids, mice, and ninjas show up for one or two levels before disappearing from the game forever, replaced by new antagonists, Inklings, giant gobs of goo, and here's where the game begins to shatter on the floor.

Inkies cannot be stomped on or slid into. Instead, you have to use the Fountain Pen, the new Pencil. While it greatly improves on the flaws of the Pencil, having to pull it out every single time an enemy is on screen instead of jumping on them and continuing on my merry way bogs down the game. Inkies are also the only enemy onwards from Level 3. There is no variety whatsoever, save for, like, one or two other types.

Level design has seen a significant downgrade. Once multi-routed levels with lots of depth are now standard, go-right until-it's-over levels. And by the way, there are five levels. That's not a complaint or anything, that's just a statement, seeing how Kongregate's description-writing is absoulutely horrid.

Bosses are an absoulute joke, too. Boss One is over in less than a minute, Boss Two is a little longer but still a joke, and the final boss is alright, but just easy, especially if you've gotten upgrades.

Although there a lot of things I like about Super Fancy Pants Adventure, I like World 3 better. I wish the best of luck to Brad Borne on World 5, and sincerely hope it's better than...well, what happened here.

38809062.review:
For those who don't want to read:
[h1]Super Fancy Pants Adventure is my FPA 4.[/h1]
If another comes out, I'll play it, but this is FPA 4 to me. 

The controls seem fast at first, but are spot-on once gameplay begins. All the abilities from 3 (the Flash game) are back, and new ones appear, such as an ink-shooting gun and a forward dash. Moves can be strung together into crevasse-crossing combos, launching you across maps in joyous ways. The game looks great, and runs amazingly for the entities on-screen, which is a necessity in a precise game such as this.

That being said, there is one glaring issue. There are quite a few areas, especially in the Volcano Entrace, where it's difficult to find your way or figure out what to do. Players, without the intuitive sense of direction that the level design should give, will throw themselves at obstacles, hoping to survive. There are also a lot of areas in which the objective is impossible to understand without first failing. This becomes annoying in sections with lots of enemies, where health is at a premium and death restarts you far, far away.

Overall, this is a great addition to the series and one I intend to replay many times.

P.S. I bet Brad Borne could make a hell of a Sonic game if he tried.

Edit: [spoiler]When you beat the ink Fancy Pants Man, the game ends on a "To Be Continued" bombshell and kicks you back to the beginning. It's [i]gutting[/i], especially after beating that boss.[/spoiler]

38382839.review:
[b]Super Fancy Pants Adventure[/b]. To those of us who grew up playing games on Kongregate and Newgrounds, the Fancy Pants games need no introduction. This series is a staple in early flash games, so the addition of a new title is a very welcome rush of nostalgia. However, despite my love for the series, I must admit that I am a little disappointed with the length of Super Fancy Pants Adventure. While the core mechanics are better than ever, there is far too little content. 

[h1][u]Positive:[/u][/h1]
[list]
[*]If you spam the down button, Fancy Pants starts rocking out.
[*]The platforming is as satisfying as ever. The Fancy Pants games do a great job with building up and maintaining momentum. I agree that it can be difficult to manage at times, especially when jumping on uneven surfaces, however, when you get it right, the game flows so beautifully. It’s almost as if you can feel the wind flow through your hair as Fancy Pants rushes through a stage.
[*]Movement feels great. For those who have never played a Fancy Pants game before, the movement is probably Fancy Pants’ strongest suit. The running, sliding, wall jumping, etc all feel very responsive and fluid. I especially enjoyed the addition of the pen gliding. 
[*]Combat feels extra smooth compared to the earlier Fancy Pants titles, especially once you unlock some of the special moves. It is quite a shame that you can’t slide into inklings though, since sliding is one of my favourite mechanics. It would also be nice if the ink storage bar could be upgraded – I often felt like my ink depleted very quickly. Though it was a nice touch that attacking inklings refills your ink. 
[*]Nice to see some of the old Fancy Pants NPCs - it really adds to the nostalgia. For example, I enjoyed seeing the pirates again and their dance moves are on point. Though I found it strange that you don’t get to see/interact with them again after you save them from the ink. 
[*]Challenges were my favourite part of the game. I found that the regular platforming wasn’t very difficult, so I appreciated the difficulty spike brought by the challenges. I also liked the minimalistic look of the challenge rooms, as it magnifies the players’ focus on the platforming. Of course, it’s great that you are rewarded with different pants or hats - wouldn’t be a Fancy Pants game without fancy pants.
 [/list]

[h1][u]Negative:[/u][/h1]
[list]
[*]I think the checkpoints could do with a little more work. There are instances where falling off the map would take me really far back and in other situations I would spawn a little forward, on a platform I had not yet touched.
[*]Unclear which platforms will move or not. I often ended up jumping off a moving platform prematurely because I didn’t expect it to move. Maybe changing the colour of the platform slightly would help resolve this issue?
[*]I enjoyed the final boss – both the fight itself and the terrain. However, I did not like that the background was so dark, as it made it difficult to see the boss when he jumped. I feel like this is an issue that could have easily been avoided.
[*]Incredibly short, especially for the price tag. I mean, I managed to finish the game in approximately 2.5 hours (mind you, I was taking my time looking for all the challenges), only to be met with an unsatisfying “to be continued”. I hope this means Borne Games plans on adding more content to this game, rather than making a whole new game.
[*]Very difficult to die. I find that the base health bar and the damage that enemies do to you is far too generous. I practically only died to the final boss, who does around a 1/5 of your health per hit. 
[*]Surprisingly little enemy variation compared to other Fancy Pants games, especially towards the end of the game. Mostly you just encounter ink blobs of various sizes. 
[*]It seems like the shooting and dashing mechanisms are just introduced and then forgotten. There are very few instances where you absolutely NEED to use the ink gun or the dash. I would have liked to see more of that incorporated in the platforming of the later stages.
[/list]

[h1][u]Conclusion:[/u][/h1]
[h1]★★★☆☆ For nostalgia’s sake[/h1]

Like many fans of the Fancy Pants games, the Super Fancy Pants Adventure release made me giddy with excitement. As to be expected, the movement, platforming, and combat are all great. However, Super Fancy Pants Adventure feels incomplete. The “to be continued” ending left me with a sour taste in my mouth. I really hope that more content will be added soon, because as it currently stands I don’t believe this game deserves the “Super … Adventure” title. I enjoyed playing SFPA, but considering that you will only get 2-3 hours of gameplay out of it, I don’t think it is worth 10€. Even if you’re a Fancy Pants fan, I would only recommend buying this game when it’s on sale.

I discovered Fancy Pants for the first time when I was ten years old, ever since the games have always been fun to play. The story is simple as it should be, the characters have charming dialogue and for the first time you get to see other stick people, nothing ground-breaking I know, but I always wondered in previous games why Fancy Pants Man was the only stick man around.

The visuals, one of my favourite thing about the whole Fancy Pants series are the visuals, backgrounds can be sometimes abstract and sometimes there's a whole story going on that you can follow as you play throught the stage. The volcano level does this very well because it's all about telleportation and moving from one background to another. 

My only complaint about this game: When beating the final boss a text appears on the screen saying TO BE CONTINUED! There better be an update soon Brad!! :(  No part 2 that'll be an entirely seperate game pls..

Super Fancy Pants adventure is slightly tough to recommend but I'm going to give it the thumbs up anyway and here's why:
Movement in this game is fun, much like all of the others in the series Super Fancy Pants adventure has incredibly tight, fluid controls that give you a myriad of fun ways to travel through levels and make you feel cool, it's super fun to pull off a backflip then land on an enemy grind on your magic ink pen and then roll down a hill. 36090817.review:
I remember playing the second Fancy Pants Adventure game on Kongregate back in the day, and every iteration afterwards. I'm very pleased with the evolution of this game into something even more special than it was all those years ago. Very little has changed aside from some polish, and I wouldn't have it any other way.

The controls are tight as heck, and it's ridiculously easy to build up a zen-like flow as you glide effortlessly through the levels. Not that it's easy, but it feels natural and effortless to control the Fancy Pants Man. Rarely will a death feel "wrong" or as if it wasn't your fault. The game isn't super difficult, but it's not without its moments of challenge.

The music is as upbeat as ever, very peppy and fun. It can get a little repetitive, as video game music tends to, but it's still good music regardless.

The visuals are fun, charming, and bouncy. Meant to deliberately evoke some of the fluidity that Flash offered to those willing to learn. The colors of the levels can get a little grating at time (Personally the bright orange level gave me a headache), but this could just be me.

The writing is minimal, but funny where it happens. It's witty and irreverent, but maybe not very much, largely because there's so little of it.

All in all, it's an excellent game, a fun time, and something I would absolutely recommend owning. 9/10.

36043928.review:
A trip down memory lane for me! I always liked the Fancy Pants Adventures series ever since I found out about it on the internet, so when the time came for Brad Borne (the developer) to make World 4, he worked on a new version of the Flash SDK (Action Script 2 to Action Script 3) and released the "tech demo", World 1 Remix! After that, Brad started the 3 year long developement of World 4 (the game you are currently looking at on this page!) and I was waiting for so long that time, it felt like a Half Life 3/TF2 Pyro Update/Portal 3(?)/Super Smash Bros for the Switch sort of situation. But then one fateful day, this game's announcement date to be precise, it was revealed that World 4 would be Super Fancy Pants Adventures and it would release on Steam. That was kind of a shock to me because I never expected the Fancy Pants Adventures series to end up on Steam of all places!

Well, enough about that part. Super Fancy Pants Adventures feels like your typical Fancy Pants game, thanks to its brilliant soundtrack and excellent controls. The story is as basic as any of the other game's stories get. But overall, I really enjoyed it. [spoiler] And according to the ending, there's going to be more content in the future! [/spoiler] I really enjoyed every second of this game. I'd recommend it to Sonic fans (as that fact is how I got into this series in the first place), Mario fans too and anyone who's just looking for a quick game to play (yes, the game's quite short at the time of me writing this). Although I wouldn't recommend this game to people expecting multiplayer (I'm looking at you TacoGao).

Edit: Now you can play World 1 Remix and some other stages with multiplayer. That's neat.

35749202.review:
The game is overall great when it comes to gameplay, you’re going to be running, jumping, sliding, wall jumping, pen surfing, and fighting enemies as you traverse through "50+ levels" of fun. Controlling "Fancy pants man" has never felt so great, and while I do love how fluid and great the game feels, I just cannot recommend this game in its current state.

(Warning: I’m going to be referring to the console game: "Fancy Pants Adventures" a lot in this review)

Pros

+Controls; very smooth and easy to control

+Combat; although it simple, it’s very satisfying

+Parkour; running, jumping, and sliding all flow together perfectly (Con: why would you take out the direction/height you could wall jump off???)

+Animation and Movement; looks and feels amazing!

+Upgrading you character; adds an extra sense of progression to the game


Cons

-56 levels; some levels actually last 2 seconds while other's usually last 5-10 minutes, honestly they feel more like screens, and it feels very deceptive that the dev(s) called some two second screens "levels". The console version and even the flash versions are perfect examples of what a level should be.

-Enemies; at the first 20 minutes of the game you get so see a large variety of different enemies, but later on all you fight are ink blobs which are not at all difficult to defeat and are frankly boring to fight after a while. You also can’t slide into the ink enemies (making the sliding mechanic feel useless). In the console game, you can battle pirates, ninjas, frogs, crabs, spiders, rats, and more! But here, you’re fighting the same ink enemies throughout the game? (Side note: there are only 4 different types of ink enemies here).

-Level design; compared to "Fancy Pants Adventures", the level design in this game feels very lazy. While in the last game you’re going through a swamp, downtown, a beach, or a cave (and many other places). In this game you’re just running along one color (either purple, orange, red, or green) for a large duration of it. The only place that actually looked different (in a good way) was the tree pirate village.

-Difficulty; The game is way too easy, collecting points refill your health bar way too much and enemies do too little damage when they hit you. It is literally impossible to die in this game, I only died once and that was because I had to purposely jump off a cliff almost 10 times or more just so I can see the death animation. The bad part is that you can also upgrade your health, making the game feel like a chore to beat since there is no danger that can harm you.

-Customization; only 20 pants and hats to collect which is almost nothing compared to the Console version of almost hundreds of items to change on your character including your weapon, pants, and head gear. The amount of customization here is just underwhelming.

-Exploration; One of the things I loved about the console version was how you could take your time and explore the level you’re in to find hidden levels because of how the levels were designed, and while there are hidden levels/challenges here, there isn't much exploring here to do. Unlike the console version, your just running though levels like it was nothing. You’re not really rewarded as much as you were in the last game for exploring, like 100% levels

-The Ending; not going to spoil anything, but the ending left me saying "that was it???".
I really hope the dev(s) are not expecting another $10 for another 2 hours of content...

-Duration of the Game; It defiantly did not last long at all, I spent x10 more time in the console game than in this game. I spent about 5 hours in this game but in reality, this game should take about 2 hours to beat and 3 hours to complete the game fully. There is almost no replayability here unlike the console game, which is the main reason why I really dislike this game.

-Overall content; going to compare it to the console version here again :), the game falls short when it comes to content. The game doesn’t last long to beat, it doesn’t have that many challenges, and it overall just gets boring near the end of the game (which is really bad since it only lasts 2 hours). In "Super Fancy Pants Adventures" you had Bonus levels, Golf, Time Trials, Trick Arenas, King of the Hill tournaments, and HD remastered versions of the flash game (World 1 and 2). Yet here all you receive is a short game and small challenge levels with little difficulty.


Conclusion

This game DEFINATLY does not deserve the name "Super" Fancy Pants Adventure, the only thing this game improved upon was the controls, combat, and animation. Content is very lackluster, little to no difficulty here, no replayability, it was just overall a disappointment from the last game. The developer did state that he will be updating this game and adding new/more challenges and even multiplayer (I was going to put no multiplayer as a con but it will be added later on) and maybe some new game modes, but I doubt it will reach the worth of the regular price it’s asking for. I would not recommend this game for $10 at all.

Now I wouldn't disregard this game altogether, the game is fun, just not $10 worth of fun.
Get this on sale if you like, maybe for $5, but otherwise it’s a no from me.

(Side note: Paid $5 for a "Fancy Key" from the developers site that promised me extra content or something for future fancy pants games like this one on steam: http://www.bornegames.com/fancy-keys/ . Haven't received anything yet. Hopefully I will receive something in the future I guess, but here's some advice to the dev -if you need money for funding you game, try Kickstarter and make promises that you "may" actually be able to keep-)

(Update 11/7/17): Turns out a new beta just dropped and added the W1 Remix to the game and Multiplayer, while both new features are still rusty atm, I’m starting to think this game is worthy of being recommended soon (Maybe)

(Edit 11/19/17): Fixed spelling errors for @Korg :)

35567296.review:
这个游戏为什么我第一时间就知道这个游戏发售了呢？当然是看某人这个游戏的直播~果然直播也是个安利途径，而且对于大多数人来说是最好安利途径，不过也会带来一些你们知道的问题……
入手的原因是：我已经好久都没有看到裤头小子的消息了，而我以前就因为玩过他的前三作（都是flash），认定了这游戏系列的素质，当然这个也和前作一样优秀。

操作：上下左右移动，s跳跃，a用笔攻击（剧情开始是3代获得的铅笔，之后就都是用钢笔了），d墨水射击，Shift冲刺。其中墨水射击和冲刺需要过剧情才能使用。
这系列越来越简单了……相比前作，这作虽然坑到处都是，但掉到无底的地方不会挂掉，只会减血后返回之前的地方……不对啊，我记得前几代虽然掉下去就挂掉了，但可以掉下去的地方实在太少，造不成威胁。
和前作一样，隐藏关卡是门，但互通关卡的就不是门了。基本上每一个普通场景都有一道这样的门，注意一下通往有些门的入口在另外一个场景里，需要多多观察。隐藏关卡里只会给你裤子颜色和头饰，让你裤头的形态更加丰富，如果一个大关的所有场景的隐藏关卡get，会获得成就。
和前作一样，boss太过于简单……boss1的话，只要在boss的砍手就行了，熟悉套路甚至可以在45秒内打败从而获取成就；第二个相对最难，可能真的会有人找不到方法，其实只要你把敌人打飞到boss身上他就会扣血，还好只有一次打它的机会；最后的boss虽然攻击力高，但招式还是挺好躲的，用好冲刺啥都不怕。

游戏过程中能特别明显的看出：裤头的整个冒险都是“纸上谈兵”，你看隐藏关卡的平台都是手绘风格，而且到？？？附近，我们可以看到，附近的方块基本变成记事本的纸。到最后裤头还逐出画外进入了另外的纸里，表明裤头的冒险远远还未结束……
看见冰淇淋车了吗？这游戏还有能力增加的，如果感觉初始能力打过关太悬，可以用从关卡里收集的圈圈购买冰淇淋来增强你的属性和为你解锁新的攻击动作，这样过关就容易多了~
另外说一下，官方似乎钦定这是world4了2333

我想来想去，也就不能改键和不太方便删档这两个问题了：
跳跃键是s总感觉有些别扭（虽然经历了这么多小时也适应了2333），我曾试着改键但发现设置里并没有改键的功能
我知道你们会觉得删档不必要加，但是对于那些想要速通的玩家来说，删档键是特别必要的，因为速通的过程是从开始游戏到完成游戏，中间不可以插入任何修改器，不可以用以前的存档。
不过我还是为大家找到了存档位置哦~
[quote=Lilfish14]C:\Users\（你的用户名）\AppData\Roaming\com.bornegames.FPAWorld4\Local Store\#SharedObjects\SFPA.swf 这个SFPA.sol就是存档[/quote]


对于喜欢爽快的横版过关游戏的玩家绝对是短暂但爽快的体验！而且成就也并不难拿到，普通成就党也可以试一下。当然玩过前作期待后续的我绝对是第一时间入手了啊！

35550403.review:
Personally I had a lot of fun playing through this game, as I loved the original games and especially enjoyed playing the Xbox game with my friends back when that came out. The controls feel amazing and fluid (I played with a controller) and the combat system was simple yet fun, and was a nice step up from the combat system on the Xbox game. The new additions to this game are great, and I love the level designs, simple as they may be. The music is pretty good too, although a bit repetitive at times. As well as the great gameplay, the game is also very quick to load up and puts you right back in the area you were last in, so you are ready to go immediately without having to navigate a menu first.

One thing to keep in mind, however, is that I have finished the story, collected every item and earned every achievement in just 3 and a half hours of play time. As much fun as I had playing it, I now feel like there is no replayability to it, other than to grind for more squiggles to buy the rest of the health and power upgrades, which isn't really worth it if there isn't anything else to play through. I don't really mind this as the experience of playing through the game was great for me, but keep in mind how short the game is when deciding whether or not to buy the game.

This game is a lot of fun. it's a fast paced platformer that rewards quick reaction and cleaver use of momentum. the developer has been developing and polishing the engine for many years and it really shows. the movement is smooth as butter and flows really nicely, also complimented by good level design. while the art style is simplistic the animations are extremely nice. However the game is pretty short and feels unfinished because of a few things.. 
it ends with a "too be continued", there's many things about the story and world that remain unresolved and unexplained and there's an area called the bathtub tower which seems to have been intended to be a central home area of sorts. it has 5 floors. early in the game you'll unlock a shop on the 1st floor that you can buy upgrades from. there's nothing to do on the other floors yet but certain things lead you to expect there will be, for example on the second floor there's an empty bar area and on the 3rd a bunch of blank arcade machines. the camera zooms into these areas like there's something to interact with but by the end of the game nothing changes. only level 1 of the tower serves a purpose. like i said the game is still fun, in fact I found my self replaying levels and challenge doors multiple times. it's fun just to roam around and play with the mechanics. I only wish the game had a main menu or a better hub area where i could replay all the challenges in one place. 

Also  an odd little thing i found. the game runs in flash but for some reason the .exe blocks access to helpful features like resizing and quality scaling.

Okay, it's been YEARS since last time I've seen anyone play a Fancy Pants game (possibly even Over a DECADE) but I recently tried this game out and it's Awesome!

The Controls feel Smooth, The Areas and Challegnes are Well Designed, The Music is Catchy, I like the Art Style, The Collectibles are Rewarding, Beating Up Enemies with Writing Utensils is EXTREMELY Satisfying, and "Inkboarding" is some of the Most fun I've EVER HAD in a Video Game!

That Being Said, There are a few problems I encountered that REALLY need to be fixed:
-When going to the Map, there's no option to cancel. I tried "B" I tried all the buttons, the only thing I can do is Spawn Myself back at the beginning of the Area (and while I CAN see that as a useful option in some areas, Most of the time, I'd rather return to the area in which I brought up the map. It's one of those BASIC THINGS that Every Video Game MUST HAVE)
-The other thing that should probably get patched is there's this one area where the perspective is Screwed Up! Fancy Pants Man is Standing ABOVE the Platforms and TO THE SIDE of sliding poles. This happened to me on the Road to the Ink Volcano area, and it was quite a ways into the Section where you're going through Portals that take you into the backgrounds and into the foregrounds, and it's in this one small part where you're close to the screen, and you're like inches above the bottomless pits and THAT'S Where it Happens (and then you move on to the next level after that)

So if Those can get patched in the near future, I think we'd be good.

Other than that though, this game is Awesome, Albeit short... (I'd say it's about the length of Sonic Mania, give or take)
This is DEFINITELY Worth your money, and I'm hoping to see more of these in the Future!

35332030.review:
@언제나 직,간접적 스포일러 주의..!@

2009년 쯤부터 작년까지 계속 재미있게 해왔던 팬시팬츠.
올해는 여러 게임을 하면서 이 게임이 있었는지도 잊고 살았었죠.
어느날 언제나 다름없이 상점을 둘러보다 이 게임의 캐릭터가 보이길래
 "에이.. 설마.." 하고 딱 눌러봤더니 진짜로. 
그토록 기다리던 팬시팬츠 어드밴쳐 월드 4... 가 아니고 슈퍼 팬시팬츠 어드밴쳐가 있었습니다.
심지어 최근에 출시했더군요. 그래서 한참을 기다리던 그 후속작을 구매하게 되었습니다.
게임을 틀었더니 언제나 나오는 우리 주인공의 침실이 보이고, 그옆엔 항상있는 문이 있었습니다.
그렇게 주인공을 깨우고 점프점프를 하는데, 모션부터가 쫀득해진것이 아주 맘에 들었습니다.
침실을 나온후 기다리고 있던건 3편에 나왔던 그의 여동생.
그러다 갑자기 여동생이 사라지고부터 이야기가 시작됩니다.


-장점-
새로운 무기, 업그레이드 시스템: 3편에선 연필을 무기로 썼다면 여기선 만년필..? 을 사용합니다. 만년필의 잉크를 총알로 사용해 원거리 공격을 할수도 있죠. 그리고 업그레이드 시스템은 라이프 늘리는거말고 딱히 쓸일이 없던 코인(비슷하게 생긴것)을 체력, 공격력을 늘리는데 사용할 수있게 해줍니다. 그리고 3가지 업그레이드스킬들은 첫번째 스킬말고 별로 쓸데 없음.(공격력 어느정도 올리면 대부분 한방이라 솔직히 말해서 무의미.)

다양한 레벨과 몬스터: 여기서 또 제작진들이 저를 실망시키지 않았습니다. 만년필로 스케이트 타기, 살아움직이고 날라다니는 잉크몬스터 등등.. (잉크침뱉는 날개달린잉크빼고) 다 맘에 들었답니다.

이게 옷찾는 게임인지뭔지..: 이쯤되면 룩딸은 필수겠죠? 그렇습니다! 맵마다 여러가지 모자, 바지를 얻을 수 있는 문이 매우 많습니다. 하지만 이게 다가 아니죠. 몇몇 문들은 찾으라고 만든건지 아닌지도 구분이 안갈정도로 도달하기 힘든 문도 있답니다!

좋은 타격감:  펜으로 후려칠때마다 잉크가 썰려나간다ㅏㅏㅏㅏㅏㅏㅏ기모티(끝)

-장점도 있다면 단점도 있겠지?-
은근히 단조로운 맵 디자인: 뭐 숲도 있고, 용암바다도 있고 그렇지만 전작과 다르게 약간 레벨 디자인이 아쉬었습니다. 3편에선 수영도 하고 사막에서 슬라이딩도 하고 숨겨진 것도 매우 많았던것에 비해선 좀 실망스러웠습니다.

타격감에 비해 통쾌함(?)이 부족한 맵: 이건 개인적인 불평이지만, 이 게임의 매력인 통쾌하게 달리고, 점프하고, 수영하고, 슬라이딩하고, 벽타고, 후려치는 시원함이 타격감해 비해 시원찮습니다. 여기저기 날라댕기는게 묘미인 게임인데, 뭔가 뻥 뚫리지 못하고 구불구불한 맵 디자인이 매우 마음에 들지 않았습니다.

너무 쉽지만 설명 안해주면 좀 힘든보스: 맵은 좀 어려우실진 몰라도 보스는 콜라 원샷하면서도 깰 정도로 아주 쉬웠습니다. 첫번째 거대한 손달린 잉크보스를 무작정 때려보지만 죽지 않았습니다. 한참이 지나고 한쪽 손을 때려보니 땅을 내려쳐 파편이 생겨 파편을 타고 올라갔더니 고드름이 있었습니다. 그걸 몇대 톡톡 치니까 그대로 보스는 고드름을 맞고끝이나죠.
두번째보스도 한참을 때리다 굴러다니던 잉크 몬스터로 때려야 죽는다는걸 알게되 클리어하였습니다.
솔직히 약점이라던가를 설명해줬다면 엄청 쉬운 보스에 이렇게 시간낭비는 하지않았을겁니다.
심지어 마지막보스는 패턴도 단조롭고 무빙만 잘하면 맞지도 않고 깰 수 도 있더군요.
난이도를 좀 올린 후 약간의 패턴을 더하면 나름 괜찮은 보스들 이었을텐데 말이죠.

-최종결론-
옛날부터 팬시팬츠를 해온 저로썬, 후속작을 내준것 만으로도 감사할 따름이죠.

The only negative thing I think I can say is that it was quite short [spoiler]but there is a "to be continued" so I get my hopes up[/spoiler]

[*][u]Game Mechanics[/u]
This new FPA game has introduced maybe my favourite feature in all the previous ones so far, the Ink Pen. I find the whole concept very smart, because it also adds and feels very nicely to the game. Platforming feels even better than before making parkour through levels an amazing experience. Although I still found glitches especially with the hard to reach platoforms there and then, it's not really an issue, and plus it can be fixed.

[*][u]Graphics/Soundtrack[/u]
One of my favourite features yet are the animations and the background drawings. The animations as said by the developer are all drawn by hand, which has a very obvious impact on how the game feels (in a positive way of course). The backgrounds make the levels feel unique and memorable (when going back at them for example you know what the yellow level has into it). The soundtrack is also staying true to the FPA style with the interesting music it has always had. Although sometimes the music can get repeatitive (when for example trying to reach a certain platform) I don't find that a negative thing, as I do enjoy all the songs.
[/list]



Overall an amazing addition to the FPA series, and as a person who played it from the beginning I do get nostalgic and I'm glad there is more on the way.


Thank you for reading

35255174.review:
TL;DR - 9/10 - Most fun 2D platformer I've played in a long time. Buy now.

My pro list is shorter than my con list by a long shot, but only because I'm hard from loving this game. My pros make up 95% of what I experienced in all of my playtime, so most of my cons are just silly gripes.

Pros:
-Movement and platforming is incredibly fast, smooth and fun.
-Combat is satisfying and fluid.
-Soundtrack and graphics blend very well together to create a very nice aesthetic.
-There's a good sense of challenge, nothing cheap that I noticed.
-No noticable bugs or preformance issues on Intel HD 630. This game is modern but a breeze to run on lower end hardware.

Cons:
-As soon as the ink pen's shooting is introduced and the enemy variation changes, combat and shooting based puzzles halt the sense of speed and momentum that came with the fast paced platforming beforehand.
-Checkpoint system is invisible and occasionally it didn't seem like I deserved to go back to the beginning of the room.
-Environment and music varation is lacking. Every challenge room has the same visual style and the same song, same goes for almost every other area in the game.
-Some features are absent in some levels: Hooks appear in the first and last levels only, the shell only appeared in the first level, and you find no NPCs in the Basement (Besides your sister), Ascent, or Volcano. I found with only a few in the Plains, and couldn't interact with any in the area with the tents just outside the Bathtub.
-The ink enemy type selection is extremely small.
-This installment is missing features from previous ones (swimming, snail golf, green squiggles that were worth 5, etc). You won't notice this if this is your first game in the series.
-Grinding in a platformer (more on this later).
-Beating the final boss reset my lives counter from 11 to 3 :(
-The bosses are the weakest point IMO. They were short and sweet, but I can't help but noticed the missed opportunity with the new gimmicks (red/yellow rails, pen surfing). They were platformer based, but didn't incorporate momentum or physics, just combat.
-Didn't care for the story at all. The only time I felt anything was talking to an NPC in the Plains who was having a rough time.

Compared to the previous games in the series, this is the game to play if you want the best controls. However, it's very clear that this game will either see a massive update, or an "Episode 2" DLC. This game is short. At the time of writing, I'm 3 hours in and I've completed all the hidden challenge levels that unlock cosmetics, but I'm still working my way through all the upgrades. I'm replaying levels to max out the upgrades. I'm grinding in a platformer. It isn't THAT bad since this game is so fun, but I feel it still should not be there. 
Another huge reason why this will get a huge update or DLC is that the Bathtub floors are void of features. There's a floor with 3 arcade cabinets. This is the 4th game in the series and the first on Steam, so it makes sense that there would be plans to port the first 3 games over in the new engine and have them playable there. But since I haven't technically beat the game 100%, I may not have unlocked everything yet.
[spoiler]Not to mention the cliffhanger ending. The "dark version of the protagonist" trope is one I can ALWAYS get down with.[/spoiler]

Yeah, I know, it sounds bad when I focus on the negatives, but again. The bad is only 10% of what I experienced.

9/10. Both as a sequel and a standalone game, it's a blast to play and is worth the price tag. It's not perfect by any means, and I am waiting eagerly for any next installment. But as much as I love the series nostalgically, I can't get lost in this game and its world for its length and minor design issues (AKA me being picky).

P.S.: Anyone know when the health and combat upgrades cap out?

35204730.review:
Well, this is a pretty big dissapointment.

I first played "Fancy Pants" back in 2009 with "World 1" on "armorgames.com". It was my first ever flash game and I thought the game was perfect back in the day. Great controls, great music and great level design. Then "World 2" came out and it was a huge improvement over the original. Even better controls, more levels, and an actual story (well kinda). After that "World 3" came out and it was even bigger and better than "World 2". A real storyline, better level aesthetics, a brand new weapon (pencil), new challenge rooms. Overall the original trilogy was perfect and if you want to know what's the best way to experience it, go buy "Fancy Pants Adventure", it has Remixed "World 1", "World 2" and "World 3", more levels, over 130+ customizations and more modes. So why am I saying all this? Because after 5 year long hiatus we finally got "World 4" and sadly, "World 4" or "Super Fancy Pants Adventure" is just ok. It's not great, it's not bad, it's just okay... 


Pro's:


- The controls are better than ever. they're much smoother and much more refined than in the previous games.


- New gimmicks like ink riding, grinding, ink shooting are actually really fun.


- New challenges are great. They're fast, they test your reflexes and most importantly - they're not boring.


Con's:


- The game is really really short. Like I beated it in 1.2 hours, how is it even possible that "World 4" is shorter than "World 3"? What did Brad say in the description of the game -- "So many levels! - 56 brand new levels of parkour platforming". More like 6 levels of platforming and 56 screen transitions. I think that is what he meant.


- Do you remember all the old enemies like spiders, mices and bats? Well say goodbye to them because they only appear for one level, after that we're introduced to the new enemies - "Ink monsters". You can no longer slide or jump at them since you'll get hurt now. Instead the only way you can kill them is with the new weapon - the pen (which permanently replaces the old pencil). Which means you have to always stop just to destroy them and clear the path which is slow and tedious.


- Where are the level themes? Back in previous games you had underground lair, islands, forests, pirate ship. In "World 4", you have only 2 level themes, and it's pirate forest and a volcano. Everything else is just a bunch of colorful platforms and blocks, like in some places it looks even more bland than "World 1". Brad also added the new layer mechanic in which you'll be jumping from one layer to another using springs and portals which sounds cool and it is. BUT sometimes (and sometimes means 90% of the time) the layers are either poorly rendered, created in a really low resolution, or have intense artifacting which makes them look really ugly.


- The soundtrack is ok. In some moments it sounded good while in other cases it sounded like something you would hear in college ads. Also, no returning music except the pirate ship theme, but really who cares?


- Where's the content, no really where is it? "20+ items"? "Fancy Pants Adventure" had 130+ items. Only hats and pants, but where are all the patterns for pants from "World 1 Remix"? Where is the weapon customization? Where's the skateboard gimmick? Where's the day/night mechanic? Where's is the remixed "World 1", "World 2" and "World 3"? Where's the multiplayer, "Fancy Box", the level editor, the hub-world like every single "Fancy Pants" game, the racing mini-game, the "Smash Bros" - like mode? Where is it?!



In the end, "Super Fancy Pants Adventure" is a good platformer, but not a good "Fancy Pants" game. I suggest you either wait for a pricedrop, or wait until Brad will add more content to it, and I sure hope he will, because this game has a lot of potential.

35204406.review:
I loved playing the Fancy Pants games all those years ago. It was such a fun sonic-esque game, with very fluid gameplay and smooth, fully-functioning mechanics. Once Super Fancy Pants Adventure on Steam, I was pretty hyped for a while. I picked it up several days ago, and it was just as I had remembered it being. It was fun, fast, and challenging when it needed to be. Now that I've finished it, I have a bunch of stuff to talk about, so let's get right into it.

THE GOOD:

- Smooth gameplay - Everything is smooth as butter. The combat is responsive and very fun to do. The platforming/parkour is even better, being able to run and jump with little to no quirks, any mistakes that happen are on you and you alone, not the game, nor the physics.

- Level Design - Every single level in here is beautifully crafted to emphasize speed and fluidity. Most levels consist solely on platforms and curved pathways, which synergizes incredibly with the fluid movement system. The scenery itself, however, is only okay at best (in my opinion)

- Boss Fights - Honestly, I was having a hard time finding out if I should keep this as a positive, all because one specific boss seemed so out of place and not very entertaining. However, I had a ton of fun with the other bosses, the final one in particular was my favorite. So, I'll keep this as a good, rather than a meh. At least the boss I don't like can be beat quickly...

The Bad:

- The Length - Unfortunately, this is the biggest reason why I'm not recommending this game. I wasn't expecting something too long, especially considering the flash games could easily be beaten in under an hour. However, for the $10 price point that they're asking for, I'm having a hard time justifying the fact that it only takes 2 hours to beat the game. Maybe 2 and a half if you're getting every single collectible. 

- The Price - Yeah, I'm kind've complaining about the price twice now, and I can already hear people saying "$10 isn't that bad, it could have been $20", and yeah, they'd be right, but I'm still having a hard time believing that $10 for 2 hours of gameplay is justifiable.

- Mechanic Introduction - So before I go into this, I should probably tack on that I haven't really played any Fancy Pants games past 2, but I have seen some gameplay on the third addition, and I can see some of the mechanics that have been brought over to this game (i.e. the actual combat instead of just jumping on things and kicking them). Top it off with all the new mechanics that were added, everything kind've fits in well. You'll get most of what you're able to do within the first or second lands, but aside from the basic stuff from the tutorials in the beginning of the game, you're not really told what you CAN do. It's only until they're arbitrarily forcing you to do a certain action to progress (and then never use that mechanic again) that they remind you that you had X ability all along.

CONCLUSION:

I wanted to like this game, and in some aspects, I definitely do. It's a really fun game to run and jump around in, and I can kick some ass here and there too. However, the game's too short. There's only such a small amount of time to get used to everything, and by the time you've done that, it's over. You don't get too much of a chance to play around with some mechanics, and there's a few that are only really used once or twice (sometimes more if you count some challenge rooms, but most of them rely on the basic movements). If there were more content, or at LEAST a level editor, I would be able to recommend this game. But where it's sitting now, it's fun, yeah, but it's not worth the money. 

TL;DR:

If you don't mind the dissapointingly short 2 hour playtime, then consider this review a recommendation. If you want more bang for your buck, just get Sonic Mania or something

There's times that I come across a game that I just loved, but really cannot recommend to others. Usually it comes down to just one thing in the game that is a complete deal breaker. Sadly, for me, Super Fancy Pants Adventure falls under that category. 

So, why the red, angry thumbs down? Quite simply, it comes down to game length. Yes, I had a lot of fun with the game; it played well, for the most part, and I can see a lot of love was given to the title. However, there just isn't much content there. I beat two bosses within the first 30 minutes of the game, which made me wonder just how much I had left. Based on what others have said, and a bit of digging on my part, I'm pretty much through the campaign already at the 77 minute mark. Granted, that's not finding all the secrets and unlocking all of the skills. So there's still a couple of hours left, but even four hours isn't that much for this price range. Unless you're really into the Fancy Pants series itself, it's just not worth it at this point. 

Perhaps, if the promised additional content comes out then it will be worth picking up, or when it's on sale. But, but it stands right now... I just don't fancy it.

    [*] Combat isn't very fun. There are upgrades to make attacking not so bad, but it's mostly just mash the attack button.
    [*] The game is VERY short. I 100%'d the game in a little more than 3 1/2 hours. 
[/list]
While it is short, that may be an advantage, because all the levels feel fun and the controls work well with the speed. The $10 asking price may be too much, I would recommend it if only so we can see a more feature filled sequel. It's a great game in a long running flash-game series.

35172591.review:
Pros:
- Extremely smooth platforming! I mean it.
- The combat system is pretty good, with Fancy Pants man being able to stomp and slide through enemies with his own platforming abilities before finishing them off with a selection of his pencil attacks.
- The customisation is great, with the player being able to choose a multitude of pants and hats to wear
- Throughout the game the player recieves upgrades to his pencil, first upgrading it to a fountain pen, then to the ability to use new attacks like dashing, spinning around like a buzz saw, and shooting ink from it like a machine gun among others.
- The art style is very unique. It may looks bland, but it fits in with the whole theme of the game being set in a cartoon world.
- The bosses require thinking in order to defeat them, unlike just running around slicing at their faces.
- There are a ton of challenges in the game that start out relatively simple, but near the end get HARD. Not just from the amount of enemies, but in the changes in direction and speed you need to make, sometimes in mid air, and the reflexes you need. They are also pretty hard to find and get to, meaning you need to explore every part of the world and leave no stone unturned!
- Great music that never gets boring! I especially liked the music in Squiggleville Plains.
- The developer spends a lot of time squashing out the bugs in recent updates!

Cons:
- Short. Like really, really short. The game is about 1-2 hours long, and some of the levels are about an entire screen long. Plus, at the end of the final boss fight, (SPOILER ALERT), you're given a "To be continued..." with not even anything to answer why you've been fighting those ink blob thingos the whole time. I'm hoping that the developer Brad Borne is going to add the rest of the story in a future update and not post it as another game.
- The enemy design cuts back to ink blobs about 30 minutes into the game and that's how it stays. There's no explanation on what happened to the spiders and ninjas you've been fighting for the past few levels, and the ink blobs can't be stomped on or slided into, which turns the mid-air parkour fighting style you've been doing into a simple game of spam the attack button.
- The game doesn't tell you what to do at the start of the game (In case your wondering the controls are arrow keys and A and S to jump and attack respectively.) I only knew that because I played the original games on the developer's website.
- There isn't a menu. Every time you start the game it launches straight in. It's not really a con but I was a tad bit annoyed that you can't select level from a menu or choose to restart the level like in earlier games. About 3/4 in you get a map to go through earlier worlds, but it's not the same since you can't choose the exact place and find the challenge rooms you missed easily, although the map does tell you in which world you missed them.

Overall though, I enjoyed the game but I think that it feels like an early access game since there's no ending to it, and things like a menu and a tutorial are missing from it. Hopefully these will be changed in future updates but for now, I'd give this game about 8/10.

*UPDATE*
As of 23/12/17 this game has an Arena and race mode, plus you can play a new world (based on the World 1 remix flash game) via the arcade machines in-game with up to 4 players! (on the same computer) This game's score has been changed to 8.5/10 because of new content and replayability, but there is still a lack of content in the main story mode.

35166164.review:
I'm going to outright list a few things here before I review unless you're THAT guy who wants to scroll to the bottom for a TL;DR, I'll put one at the bottom, you lazy person you. First off:

1. I am a huge fan of the Fancy Pants Series
2. I finished the game all the way to completion
3. I hadn't played the game in a long time

Super Fancy Pants Adventires is a fun and exciting game to play, and it is something I think anyone from all ages can enjoy. The best way I can some it up is that it's a momentum platformer game, with Hack and Slash elements that build off of what was experienced at the end of Fancy Pants 3. Yes I said Fancy Pants 3, there are a lot of games out there already, and I recommend checking them out. The game isn't that long once you get the mechanics down, it's a very simple combo system, but the game adds new things throughout your playthrough that make it more interesting. There are hidden easter eggs, and challenges that allow you to collect fancy hats and pants. The challenges are designed to teach you about certain tricks when platforming, or attacking, which I think is pretty cool.

I also want to say, from what I've seen of my playthrough, I don't think this is an entire game, as some parts of the map seem incomplete, or some things look like they are designed to be interacted with, but were never made to, mechanics wise, I think it's really worth it, as people can have fun for hours on end, even in a smaller area that the maps provide, as running through again, isn't boring, as once you have all the abillites, you can find new ways to make your way around the map, and sometimes find challenges you couldn't see before.

TL;DR
It's a fun platformer, if albeit a bit short, I do think more content is going to be added at a later date though, which has got me excited for what's in store for the rest of the game. If you want to wait for more, then that's fine I totally understand that, but I do want to say that the gameplay is really worth it, even if the game isn't that long.

35123472.review:
Spoilers ahead, if you really care.

It was 2011, and one of my friends had told me about a browser game called 'Fancy Pants'. He said it was a really great game that he found on Miniclip, and so I soon gave it a try and enjoyed it heaps. I also played the sequel on Miniclip, enjoying that throughly. A year later, I discovered the iOS version which added a whole new world as well as the previous two for a solid $3 or $4. The amount of enjoyment and time I got out of it was well worth it, and I recently redownloaded it on my new phone and have 100%ed each world again, bringing back some nostalgia. I soon found out that a new Fancy Pants game was coming out on Steam, and I was pretty excited. However, I can't say that Super Fancy Pants Adventure really lived up to my expectations.

Overall, I sort of enjoyed Super Fancy Pants Adventure. It was a fun addition to the series and has some of the smoothest and fast-paced gameplay the series has ever had. However, it is bogged down by an overexpensive price tag (even $10 is too much imo) in relation to its lack of content, somewhat repetitive nature and ending which left me feeling deceived, to a degree.

As stated, the gameplay is super fun, if the levels do feel a bit samey. I dislike the way that the pencil and pen are real jpegs in game as it takes away from the style I feel, but that's just a minor gripe. However, in other places when it comes to game design and graphics, it just is not very good. I was playing in fullscreen and you can somewhat tell this is not the game's native resolution. I remember in particular there was one run which looked like something you could run up, but was instead something you had to continously jump up. Why? There is also not much indication of platforms that you can actually move through and the consistency of walls for jumping off is lacking. Some other aspects of design are just flat out lazy, like when you increase your health bar and instead of continuing the pattern or colour, it would just be white next to the colour you've chosen. How did this make it to the final product?

I could sort of get past all this though, if it weren't for it being grossly overpriced for a game that is, at most, 2 hours worth of largely unsatisfying content. The levels don't have the same charm and persona as previous games, particularly World 3 imo. Not only this, but the ending was legit fighting a dark Fancy Pants then falling into a white abyss and then the words 'To be continued..." show up on screen. I felt cheated. Also, do NOT believe there are 57 levels. There are 57 sections of levels, but all the indiviudal areas are what I actually consider levels, and there is only 7 or 8 of these. They are all pretty samey but still fun to travel through due to the great gameplay, but still, World 3 had 13 or 14 levels and were infinitely more varied and interesting. I hope more comes as free DLC, because I won't be paying full price for another game if this is the level of content we will get. 

I wouldn't say the game is without value necessarily, but its value certainly does not surpass $5. The iOS version of Fancy Pants Adventures had more content, not only including a slew of original levels, but also bundling in Worlds 1 and 2, and the best part was that you didn't even have to spend $5. I almost wish the game were just that tad bit shorter so I could've refunded it. 

Apparently there's some Fancy Key you can buy on Brad's website that gives you access to a bunch of Fancy Pants content that's yet to come. Why was this not advertised elsewhere? The one that's $5 includes a World 1 remix and future access to all other Fancy Pants games. Why is this one $10 then?

(It's important to note I didn't do EVERY single challenge but I still did quite a few. Still, not everyone is going to intently do the challenges and they will finish it even quicker. You could probably speedrun this very quickly.)

35119578.review:
This game has a lot of pros, and one con. I'm gonna start with that one con: It's short. Like, really short. I blew through it in a couple hours. Granted, there are quite a few optional challenge rooms, many of which I missed, but still, I can't imagine it taking more than 3 or 4 hours to fully exhaust the content on offer if you know what you're doing.

BUT, having said that, it's an incredibly fun game that I'm most certainly going to be revisiting over the years. It's got an excellent sense of inertia and momentum to the movement, it's not so much platforming as it is 2D parkour. The game isn't about landing pixel-perfect jumps, it's about managing and directing your momentum in order to get where you need to go. Additionally, the game is beautifully hand-animated; some of the assets don't scale exceptionally to higher resolutions, but the cozy yet polished art direction more than makes up for some technically lacking textures. 

When you combine the movement physics, the lovely, rolling level design, and the beatiful animation, the result is a game which flows beautifully and just feels incredibly smooth and fun to play, and this is only helped by the fact that it runs at a silky 60fps.

That's without even getting into some of the special mechanics that are unlocked over the course of the game, all of which are pretty well-realized and complement the core moveset. In particular, I like the pen-riding sections, which are sort of a microcosm of the swooshing, looping, momentum-heavy gameplay. 

This is just an excellent game, the mechanics more than make up for the somewhat lacking length, and I think that your moveset lends it quite a lot of replayability due to just how sheerly, viscerally GOOD everything feels on a fundamental level.

Granted, a good chunk of enjoyment for me also came from nostalgia for the expreiences of playing the early FPA games on various flash portals, but this is definitely a game which lives up to the nostalgia rather than being carried by it.

I highly recommend buying this game. It's definitely worth the ten dollars.

35097385.review:
Ooooh man. This was a complete and total surprise, and I didn't even know this game existed until literally the day it released. But boy am I not disappointed that I found out.

First of all, an admission- I am probably biased, because I played some of the older Flash-based Fancy Pants games. That out of the way...

...this game is awesome. The Fancy Pants games have always been about smooth, and incredibly intuitive platforming. And some defying of the laws of physics, but that's par for the course in platformers. You don't get a double jump, but rolling, sliding, wall jumps, and all sorts of other things are available, and are very easy to grasp... although I'd strongly recommend playing with a controller rather than a keyboard unless you change the controls a bit. The default keyboard controls are a bit awkward.

New to this game (I think) is, well, a weapon. Starts as a pencil, then you replace it with a pen to let you essentially 'inkboard' around on giant panels, which is not only a lot of fun but also massively increases the possibilities when it comes to platforming, and it's later upgraded to shoot (a little wonky but it works fine for the situations it's required for), and then to let you perform ink dashes. Altogether, it's a pretty simple-to-use weapon, but there's not many things as satisfying as performing a home run with a spider.

It IS worth noting, it'll probably take you about 2-3 hours to complete the main story, so it's a touch short, but there's a lot of challenges to complete, and all sorts of hidden stuff to find- and you can go back for it pretty easily. The boss battles are a touch basic, but the final boss is actually quite fun. Not to mention, the platforming itself is also really fun in general. Ultimately, although the game overall is a bit short, I'd still say it's worth your ten bucks.

Especially with the music and incredible art. Seriously, I wish I could see how this looks in 4K. There's a LOT of work put into this game, and it shows.

35092358.review:
I just beat the game in 1.1 hours. Before we start, I just want to say I'm a huge fan of the previous games and especially the one on Xbox. Let's talk about the things the game advertises on the store page.

-So many levels! - 56 brand new levels of parkour platforming

There is a total of about 8 "worlds" and each of them is divided up into like 6 rooms. None of the art really changes throughout the worlds and they are super short. To me it felt like there was 8 levels. It's like they consider every checkpoint a level. Some of the "levels" literally fit on one screen.

-Collections! - Over 20 pants and hats to collect in brand new challenge stages

The last game let you collect hats, pants, and swords. There were 141 total items iirc. "Over 20!" wow that is really underwhelming. I didn't really feel incentivised to even collect them. I did a few challenge stages and then just avoided them the rest of the game.

-Incredible Hand-drawn Style - Frame-by-frame animated worlds, enemies, and friends

The animations for fancy pants man were pretty good however the general enviorment art was incredibly lazy. Every level is just one or two colors (watch the trailer again) with plenty of reused assets throughout the game. Also, the main enemy was literally a blob, which I feel was only picked because it's so damn easy to animate. They also stripped down some of fancy pants moves which I feel could have just been to do less animating. It's sad that "hand drawn" is becoming an excuse for just not doing that much.

-Hack-and-slash - Wield your mighty ink pen to take down new threats!

Not much to say here. The combat was really bland you just tap attack over and over. Even the boss fights were super bland: you just press attack at a different time then usual. However, I will say the Xbox game also had this issue. It tends to just be easier to skip enimes throughout the whole game since you can literally jump over anyone.

-New Moves! - Take control of Fancy Pants man with brand new combos and moves

So there is an upgrade shop where you can buy 3 different sword moves (one of which was a default in the last game.) They are completley unneccesary and I actually beat the game before I was able to afford any of them. They don't help, it feels like they only exist to give you a false sense of progression.

Secret Challenge Stages - Scattered throughout the world are secret doors to incredibly challenging bonus stages, awarding awesome prizes

Like I mentioned earlier, these are just so you can find pants. I started avoiding them pretty early on since they weren't fun.

-60fps gameplay - Perfectly smooth running for a perfectly smooth platformer

Nice

Other miscallaneous issues
-Overall, just bad platforming. Sometimes the camera couldn't keep up very well, causing you to jump off a cliff. Lots of poorly telegraphed jumps or platforms that would move unexpectedly. The same color platform could move up or left and it cause a lot of dumb deaths. There is one room where you go bottom to top, but if you mess up you just fall lto the bottom instead of dying. It's really annoying. Lots of stuff like that, plus a few bad hitboxes on walls, cause you to miss easy jumps.

-They completley ruined walljumping. You no longer choose what direction you jump off the wall. The tutorial says they did it because it is "easier" but it just gives you less control over the character and makes cheap deaths. How is it easier to NOT let me control where I go? This game doesn't let a good player be good.

-No multiplayer ;/

Literally the game is worse then the old one that you can play for free online, AND you have to pay $10 to play this. If we are comparing them, this one has 60 fps and controller support. the online one has actual levels with actual art, 141 items, more then 10 lines of dialouge, and a ton more.

I mean where is all the charm?? The old games had all those little jokes in the background and tons of things to do in every level. The old house has the litrtle animated celine fan and fish and pictures and stuff. This new house is literally empty. NOTHING. White walls.

-Where is the swimming???

-Awkward soundtrack with really awkward transitions

Anyway, the best way to play would be on an Xbox 360, but 2nd best goes to playing the free online one. This game was underwhelming and not worth a single dollar

35089955.review:
As much as I want to love this game, it feels like it has a lot of core issues. I'll just list the positives and negatives to save you guys some time.

[u][h1]Positives:[/h1][/u]
[list]
[*]Movement feels the [b]best[/b] it's ever been! All the new level mechanics feel great to use. I personally love swinging around poles.
[*]Combat has been polished up a bit since the release of Fancy Pants Adventure, which is great!
[*]Layer mechanics are fun
[*]Challenges are a great addition!
[/list]

[u][h1]Negatives:[/h1][/u]
[list]
[*]Other layers are either [b]poorly rendered[/b], created in a really low resolution, or have intense artifacting
[*]Overabundance of enemies as soon as what I believe is the second level
[*]No easing into game mechanics. [b]No listing of controls anywhere[/b] outside of the new pensliding mechanic.
[*]Pretty buggy. I softlocked more than a few times by accidentally grabbing corners of breakable blocks that couldn't be broken.
[*]Overall odd [b]lack of polish[/b] in levels
[*]Levels all feel the [b]same[/b]. As far as I have played, there are no real individual level mechanics or landmarks. I suppose those 56 new levels came with a price.
[*]Mysterious lack of sounds for text boxes. Maybe it's just me, but it feels weird for it to be completely silent when you advance text.
[*]Music all feels the same so far. When I saw the trailer a few days ago, I got a bit worried. I hoped that the song may just be an "epic final level song" or something, but the entire OST is in the same style. This [b]new style of music feels completely different from the other Fancy Pants games[/b] and (in my opinion) not to its advantage. The story and text is still just as "random", so this new "epic music" style just doesn't mesh, in my opinion.
[*]Placement that's not very well thought out. Around 10 minutes into the game, there's a challenge door that's surrounded by breakable blocks. Unfortunately, it seems that whoever designed the levels didn't consider that when exiting the challenge, the player might want to hit up...if you do, you go right back in. Also the softlock issue. It feels like the game hasn't been playtested at all outside of the main mechanics.
[/list]


As much as I respect Brad, this game might be a step down from FPA in terms of level design, even if there are more levels. There are a lot of great new touches (challenge doors, penriding, etc), but it's not worth the hit in level design. It's unlikely this will ever be fixed since it's a core issue, so I'd recommend this game only if this all sounds ok to you.

Edit: There's no way to tell which platforms are "jump through" or not. Got stuck in a small area for about a minute before I found that the ceiling was jump through.

[h1]Oh boy, the disappointment[/h1]

Platforming is broken - You can't wall jump properly and keys randomly choose not to register, or you just stop moving for no apparent reason.

There's no indication as to what any of the controls are, but of course, S is jump and A is attack. Of course.

The original levels aren't anywhere to be seen in this, nor are the PS3 levels. There's also no inspiration whatsoever to the new levels, it's just run, jump, run, jump, with nothing fun to break it up.

There's also a 60fps lock, which seems arbitrary.
